thread.title: Volleyball: Rogers Heritage sweeps Rogers High
thread.title_full: Volleyball: Rogers Heritage sweeps Rogers High

title: Volleyball: Rogers Heritage sweeps Rogers High
text:
By Paul Boyd Posted: October 21, 2015 at 1 a.m. 
ROGERS -- Rogers Heritage locked up the No. 5 seed from the 7A-West Conference for next week's state tournament and knocked off cross-town rival Rogers High in a hard-fought 3-0 (26-24, 25-22, 26-24) victory Tuesday night in War Eagle Arena. 
The Lady War Eagles (17-10-1, 6-8 7A-West) turned back a set point in the opener and scored four straight to stun the Lady Mounties, then scored two straight -- the final on a service ace by senior Alye Darter -- to close out the match. 
In between, Heritage used a 12-1 run to take control of the second set, but had to hold off a late Rogers charge for the victory. 
Heritage coach Sarah Miser got big contributions from seniors Elleson Dunagin, Alye Darter and Lindsay Glynn as usual, but she also acknowledged senior right-side hitter Paige Gallaway junior middle hitter Hope Von Gremp, along with sophomore Erika Reaser. 
Dunagin finished with a match-high 18 kills to go with 12 digs, while Darter contributed a match-high 24 digs. Glynn dished out 30 assists to lead the Lady War Eagles statistically. But Von Gremp and Gallaway came up at big plays late in each set. 
"Elleson, Lindsay and Alye were pretty consistent," Miser said. "But we had some other people step up tonight. Paige didn't get many swings, but when she did, she made them count. Hope had some big kills out of the middle to help us get that lead in the second set. 
"Erika Reaser came in in that third set and that's intimidating with a 6-2 girl on the other side. But she took care of the ball. We had a lot of people step up tonight." 
Heritage will play at 2 p.m. Tuesday in the state tournament at Conway High School against the No. 2 seed from the 6A/7A East. 
Rogers coach Jeanna Breedlove said her team gave away too many points early and waited too long to rally. But the Lady Mounties will look forward to next week's state tournament. 
"We kind of struggled with the environment in that second set," Breedlove said. "They responded too late in both the first and second sets. We're not going to look backwards. We're going to look forward. A lot of my girls got playing time tonight and maybe that will bolster confidence and they will come together as a team with lots of energy and enthusiasm." 
Senior Samantha Lassiter led Rogers with 14 kills, while sophomore Hannah Martin chipped in with 10 kills and 14 digs. Madison Sherrill led the Lady Mounties with 16 digs, while Audrey Herrera had a match-high nine blocks. 
Rogers (16-15-3, 5-9) will be the No. 6 seed in the tournament and face the No. 2 seed from the East at 6 p.m. Tuesday. 
Sports on 10/21/2015
